your rights when terminated from employment","phrases":["I'd like the reason for my termination in writing.","Please provide my final paycheck and a breakdown of all wages owed.","I am requesting a copy of my personnel file.","I will be filing for unemployment benefits.","I want to speak to an attorney before signing anything."],"rights":[{"title":"Protection from Discriminatory Firing","description":"Your employer cannot fire you because of your race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age (40+), disability, or because you reported illegal activity. Discriminatory termination is illegal. If you were fired and suspect discrimination, document the timeline and keep performance reviews, emails, and witness information.","source":"Title VII of the Civil Rights Act, Age Discrimination in Employment Act (ADEA), ADA","stateVariations":[]},{"title":"Right to Final Paycheck","description":"You are entitled to all wages you've earned up to your termination date. Timing varies by stateâ€”some require immediate payment, others allow a final paycheck on the next regular payday. Employers cannot withhold earned wages as punishment. Check your state's specific timeline requirements.","source":"State Wage and Hour Laws and Fair Labor Standards Act (FLSA)","stateVariations":[{"state":"CA","note":"Final paycheck due immediately on last day of employment, or earlier if requested"},{"state":"NY","note":"Final paycheck due next regular payday or within a few days at most"},{"state":"TX","note":"Final paycheck due next regular payday"},{"state":"UT","note":"Final paycheck due next payday or within 15 days"},{"state":"FL","note":"No specific state statute; follows federal FLSA (next payday is standard)"}]},{"title":"Right to COBRA Health Insurance","description":"If your employer has 20+ employees, you can continue your group health insurance for up to 18 months after termination by paying the premium yourself (usually about 102% of the employer's cost). COBRA helps bridge the gap until you get new coverage. Your employer must notify you of this right.","source":"Consolidated Omnibus Budget Reconciliation Act (COBRA) of 1985","stateVariations":[{"state":"CA","note":"California also has Cal-COBRA for employers with fewer than 20 employees"},{"state":"NY","note":"New York has state continuation coverage options similar to COBRA"}]},{"title":"Whistleblower Protection","description":"You cannot be fired for reporting illegal activity, safety violations, environmental crimes, or other unlawful conduct to government agencies or law enforcement. This protection applies even if you report internally first. Whistleblowers have legal remedies including reinstatement and damages.","source":"Whistleblower Protection Act (OSH Act Â§ 11(c)), Sarbanes-Oxley, Dodd-Frank","stateVariations":[{"state":"CA","note":"Strong whistleblower protections; can include damages and attorney fees"},{"state":"NY","note":"NY Labor Law protects whistleblowers; robust legal framework"},{"state":"TX","note":"Limited whistleblower protections; primarily federal law applies"}]},{"title":"Right to Unemployment Benefits","description":"If you are fired without cause, you can apply for unemployment insurance benefits. You'll receive a percentage of your previous wages for a limited period (typically 26 weeks). Apply immediately after termination. Your employer may contest your claim, but if you were fired unfairly, benefits are likely approved.","source":"State Unemployment Insurance Laws and Federal UI Framework","stateVariations":[{"state":"CA","note":"Up to 52 weeks of benefits with extensions during high unemployment"},{"state":"NY","note":"Up to 26 weeks of regular UI; extended benefits available in high unemployment periods"},{"state":"TX","note":"Up to 26 weeks of regular benefits; some extensions available"},{"state":"UT","note":"Up to 26 weeks of benefits; apply through Department of Workforce Services"},{"state":"FL","note":"Up to 12 weeks of benefits; rates vary by prior earnings"}]}]},"availableStates":["CA","FL","NY","TX","UT"]}]}],"$L4"]}],null,"$L5"]}],"loading":null,"isPartial":false}
